direct_enhancements.reason: Both methods provide iterators over the map's values, but 'iterator()' provides a flattened view of all mappings.
Both methods return views of the map's contents, with 'entrySet()' returning a set of key-value pairs and 'values()' returning a collection of values.
Both methods access the map's keys, with 'keySet()' returning the set of keys and 'values()' indirectly accessing keys to retrieve values.
The 'values()' method relies on 'getCollection(Object)' to retrieve collections of values, making it a direct dependency.
Both methods deal with the size of the map's contents, with 'totalSize()' calculating the total number of values and 'values()' returning a collection of all values.
